description.narrative:
CCC is the longest-established membership organization in Cambodia. Since 1990, it has played a unique role in strengthening effectiveness of the Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) working across diverse sectors in Cambodia. By end of 2019, CCC is the umbrella ofaround 200 NGOs and associations whose works touch on various development fields as our members. To fulfil the expectation and interest of its members, CCC has adopted member-cantered as one of the four working approaches of the organization. Itis CCC’s belief that the strengths of civil society in Cambodia is in the hand of its members. To expand the accessibility of its services to other CSOs, CCC has gone into collaboration agreement with 15 provincial NGO networks through which the agreementwill enable everyone to join efforts in the areas of network strengthening, resource mobilization, advocacy and other areas related to the enabling environment. Besides its members, CCC will also count those networks and its members and partners as the beneficiaries of this project. They will be able to strengthen their quality of works, to better harmonize, to better comply with the laws, to effective mobilize and use of resources, as well as mainstream CCC’s vision and efforts to communities and individual citizens across the country.
CCC has secured its space to enter the dialogues with the government on legal compliance and priority policies and advocacy related to the operating environment of the sector, specifically related to the legal frameworkimpacting CSOs in Cambodia. CCC plays a unique role as an enabling agent to facilitate civil society to collectively response and accountably work together for respect of human rights, democracy, good governance, enabling environment and sustainabilityofCSOs to achieving its vision for sustainable development for Cambodia.
The Specific objectives of the project are:
- To facilitate CSOs to have collective and professional advocacy on legal framework compliance, policies reforms, and advocacy -To ensure that space for CSOs is promoted for inclusive partnership in development,implementation and reform of key relevant national and sub-national policies through partnership dialogue - To enhance the compliance capacity and awareness of CSOs inaddressing the enabling environment and relevant development priorities in Cambodia

participating-org.narrative: The Cooperation Coomiitee for Cambodia (CCC) was established in 1990 as an association of Civil Society Organisations in Cambodia. It is a leading network strengthening the cooperation, professionalism, accountability, governance and effectiveness of itsmembers and representing the sector to the government and donors. It aims to contribute to a cohesive, accountable and transparent NGO sector, contributing more effectively to the development of Cambodia.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
